overview: The following was filmed “run & gun” on the street in NYC over the last week. On the streets during the recent protests in NYC, I felt an obligation to use my privilege to tell stories as an attempt to bridge gaps. Some might call protestors “agitators”, “trouble makers” or even “criminals”. What I found were impassioned human beings. In this piece three young leaders in the #blacklivesmatter movement are followed. There were no emails, or phone calls. I simply approached them on the street. Their passion for justice, and for reforming our beleaguered policing system was inspiring. This is meant to be a real life look in the moment and on the streetIt’s an open discussion about police violence and about protest.”
title: A Week In June
